unnormalised: The CBSE has announced the results for the Class 10 board exams. Overall pass percentage stands at 93.12%. Girls outperformed boys with a pass percentage of 94.25% as compared to 92.72% for boys. Students can check their results on the official website cbseresults.nic.in.
normalised: The C-B-S-E has announced the results for the Class ten board exams. Overall pass percentage stands at ninety three point one two percent. Girls outperformed boys with a pass percentage of ninety four point two five percent as compared to ninety two point seven two percent for boys. Students can check their results on the official website c b s e results dot n i c dot in.

unnormalised: The board also released the merit list for the top 0.1% of students in each subject. Anya Sharma from Delhi Public School, R.K. Puram, secured 498/500. Students can obtain their digital mark sheets from DigiLocker using their roll number and school code.
normalised: The board also released the merit list for the top zero point one percent of students in each subject. Anya Sharma from Delhi Public School, R-K. Puram, secured four hundred and ninety eight divided by five hundred. Students can obtain their digital mark sheets from DigiLocker using their roll number and school code.

unnormalised: This year, the board conducted the exams from 15/02/2024 to 13/03/2024. A total of 21.8 lakh students appeared for the exam across India. The compartment exams are scheduled to be held in July, the exact dates for which will be announced later.
normalised: This year, the board conducted the exams from fifteenth February two thousand and twenty four to thirteenth March two thousand and twenty four. A total of twenty one point eight lakh students appeared for the exam across India. The compartment exams are scheduled to be held in July, the exact dates for which will be announced later.

unnormalised: Re-evaluation requests can be submitted online from 27/05/2024 till 05/06/2024 for a fee of â‚¹500 per subject. CBSE officials have congratulated all successful candidates and wished them luck for their future endeavours.
normalised: Re-evaluation requests can be submitted online from twenty seventh May two thousand and twenty four till fifth June two thousand and twenty four for a fee of rupee five hundred per subject. C-B-S-E officials have congratulated all successful candidates and wished them luck for their future endeavours.
